title.narrative: SGBV Prevention and Response in Disasters - Asia

description.narrative: This project aims to prevent and reduce the occurrence of sexual and gender based violence at the community level particularly in times of crisis. As gender based violence is closely linked to harmful gender based norms and beliefs it will also seek to change attitudes toward violence in order to decrease the tolerance of sexual and gender based violence. In the Philippines the project will be piloted in between four to six communities in Tacloban city and Aklan province. The chosen communities will be confirmed based on planning mission reports and agreed to once at the inception workshop at the start of the project. In Indonesia the project will be piloted in between three to six communities in Aceh province and Bima City. If successful and dependant on the level of funding available the project could then be scaled-up rolled out to other communities and potentially implemented in other countries in the region. This project will primarily work with women and girls as they are disproportionally affected by SGBV. However we know from experience that exclusion of men and boys in such programmes distorts household dynamics and results in more violence towards women and girls and as such men and boys will also be engaged as key participants in this project.
